multi_topic_discovery.topic_discovery_motivation: Impact: FX; Rising UK 30‑year gilt yields and global fiscal worries push sterling and yen lower, lifting the dollar and affecting other currencies.

category.motivation: The article describes market reactions to fiscal deficits and political uncertainty, providing commentary on currency movements, which fits a market commentary category.

impact.motivation: The article reports a rise in the dollar against sterling, yen, euro and AUD, indicating a short‑term strengthening of the USD relative to major peers, which is directly relevant to the USD/DXY node. The move is modest and tied to short‑term risk sentiment, so the impact is medium.

time_frame.motivation: The article reports on immediate market reactions to fiscal deficit concerns, political uncertainty, and yield movements, which are short‑term catalysts for currency prices.

article_node.title: Sterling, yen dragged by fiscal and political worries
article_node.summary: The British pound and Japanese yen fell amid renewed worries over global fiscal deficits and political uncertainty in Japan.  Rising 30‑year gilt yields pushed sterling down more than 1%, while the yen slipped after a key Japanese political figure signaled resignation.  The dollar gained on the back of these moves, and other currencies such as the euro and Australian dollar saw modest declines as investors turned to safe‑haven assets.
